definition: ferocious mythological animal, the fifth son of the dragon king/zoomorphic mask motif, found on Shang and Zhou ritual bronzes/gluttonous/sumptuous (banquet)
gluttonous/see 饕餮[tao1 tie4], zoomorphic mask motif
gluttonous/see 饕餮[tao1 tie4], zoomorphic mask motif
glutton/gourmand/by extension, person who is greedy for power, money, sex etc
great meal fit for dragon's son (idiom); sumptuous banquet
zoomorphic mask motif

sentences.english: Can you read these two characters?
sentences.chinese: 你會讀“饕餮”這兩個字嗎？

sentences.english: The result is, these investor were shared finally gluttonous fill a banquet.
sentences.chinese: 結果是，這些投資者最後都分享到了饕餮盛宴。

sentences.english: There were so many musical instruments of Shang dynasty unearthed and most of which had decorative patterns of gulosity on their surfaces.
sentences.chinese: 商代出土樂器衆多，其紋飾則以饕餮紋樣爲主導。

sentences.english: They had all the pleasures of gluttony but paid none of the price.
sentences.chinese: 它們可以盡情饕餮，但卻不用付出任何代價。

sentences.english: Tasting global cate is the greatest cherished desire of gluttonous gens.
sentences.chinese: 嚐遍全球美食是饕餮一族的最大心願。

sentences.english: THE FACTS Late November marks the start of the gluttonous holiday season.
sentences.chinese: 十一月下旬是饕餮假期的開始。

sentences.english: "This was a perfect, perfect score for the rats, " he says.
sentences.chinese: “這真是老鼠的一頓饕餮大餐啦，”他說。

sentences.english: Great Value, the prices have been slashed.
sentences.chinese: 物超所值的饕餮盛宴大幅降價。

sentences.english: Since Camilla and I are food freaks , we were in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 卡米拉和我都是饕餮，對我們來說這就是天堂呀。

sentences.english: Sloth does not set in until after gluttony and avarice.
sentences.chinese: 懶惰之罪只犯在饕餮和貪心之後。

sentences.english: Sometimes he gets hungry and eats like a glutton.
sentences.chinese: 他有時弄得飢腸轆轆且暴食如饕餮。

definition: legendary beast
gluttonous/see 饕餮[tao1 tie4], zoomorphic mask motif
nine-tailed fox (mythological creature)
see 眥睚|眦睚[zi4 ya2]
tapir
sb who is always hungry/glutton/(Buddhism) hungry ghost

four divinities/four divine emperors/four mythical creatures symbolic of prosperity and longevity, namely the phoenix 鳳|凤[feng4], turtle 龜|龟[gui1], dragon 龍|龙[long2] and Chinese unicorn 麒麟[qi2 lin2]/also 四象[si4 xiang4], the four division of the sky
mythological animal
to devour
Classic of Mountain and Sea, probably compiled c. 500 BC-200 BC, contains wide range of geography, mythology, witchcraft, popular customs etc
Black Tortoise (the seven mansions of the north sky)/(in Daoism) God of the north sky
three-legged Golden Crow that lives in the sun (in northeast Asian and Chinese mythology)/Korean: samjog'o
beast/animal/beastly/bestial
White Tiger (the seven mansions of the west sky)/(slang) hairless female genitalia
rare animal/mythical animal/monster
demon
